location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: ‘REDUCED COPY OF CHART OF THE GULF OF PERSIA. Constructed from the Trigonometrical Surveys. Made by Order of THE HONBLE THE COURT OF DIRECTORS OF THE UNITED ENGLISH EAST INDIA COMPANY and to whom it is Respectfully Dedicated by their most obedient Servant GEORGE BARNES BRUCKS Commander H.C. Marine. 1830’

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:432 x 552 mm, on sheet 480 x 641 mm

mods.abstract: Imprint:Litho.d in the Chief Eng.r’s Office by F. de Jesus and H. Essentjee, Bombay, 26th Jan.ry 1856. (Signed) J.S. Gell, Captain for Lieutt. Coll. Adams, Depy. Qr. Mr. General.Distinctive Features:Relief shown by hachures.Nautical chart with detail soundings recorded in fathoms. Hazardous features including rocks, shoals and reefs marked and labelled ‘unsafe to navigate without a pilot & only in the dry time’. Island off Trucial coast indicated as ‘East India Company’s Islands’. Includes an explanatory note on survey and sources used in compiling the map.
